com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi

Interface IPluginController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Abstract4diacPluginController, AbstractActorController, AbstractPluginController, AbstractSensorController, AbstractSingleComponentController, BatteryActorController, BatterySensorController, GenericActorController, GenericForteController, GenericSensorController, LoadSensorController, PVActorController, PVSensorController, SGReadyHeatPumpController

    public interface IPluginController
    Interface for controllers that can be added as plugin to Polysun. I.e. this interface defines a controller. This is the Service Provider Interface (SPI). Objects will be created by the default constructor. Thus, a constructor without any parameters must be available. A plugin controller has uses the following concepts:
    • Sensors, input values "measured" in Polysun
    • Control signals, the output of the control algorithm
    • Logs, intermediate values to log and show in Polysun
    . There are configured and generic sensors and control signals. Generic sensors and control signals behave as in ProgrammableController of Polysun. Available values in the general parameters set by Polysun:
    • Plugin.DataPath, String: Proposed path for config data, within the Polysun user data folders
    • Polysun.UserLevel, Integer: Level of the current license, 2 = Professional, 3 = Designer, 4 = Developer
    • Polysun.Version, Long: The current version number, as Long
    • Polysun.DataPath, String: Path to the data folder of Polysun.
    • Polysun.DataPathAbsolute, String: Absolute path to the data folder of Polysun.
    • Polysun.InstallPath, String: Path to the Polysun executable
    Available values in the general parameters read by Polysun:
    • Plugin.PrintMessage, String or List<String>: Message(s) written to the Polysun MessageArea
    Since:
    Polysun 9.1
    Author:
    rkurmann
    See Also:
    PluginControllerConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The human readable name of the plugin controller. E.g. "Flowrate". This method is called if the name of the plugin controller is required.
        Returns:
        Short name, must not null

      • getCreator

        java.lang.String getCreator()
        The creator of this plugin controller. E.g. "Vela Solaris". This method is called if the creator of the plugin controller is required.
        Returns:
        Plain text or null if there is creator.

      • getVersion

        java.lang.String getVersion()
        The version of this plugin controller. E.g. "1.0". This method is called if the version of the plugin controller is required.
        Returns:
        Plain text (semantic versioning suggested) or null if there is no version

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        A short description of this plugin controller. E.g. "Controls the status (on/off) of one or two different components and the flowrate of a given pump based on two flowrate sensors." This method is called if a description of the plugin controller is shown.
        Returns:
        Plain text or null if there is no description

      • getDocumentation

        java.lang.String getDocumentation()
        Documentation of this plugin controller. This method is called if a documentation of the plugin controller is shown.
        Returns:
        Plain text or HTML or null if there is no description

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Is this plugin controller enabled?
        Parameters:
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        true if enabled, otherwise false

      • getConfiguration

        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerConfiguration getConfiguration(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
                                                                              throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        Configuration of this plugin controllers. E.g. the properties in the controller setting GUI, the sensors, the log values and the signals to control. This method is called when the plugin controller in Polysun is created and every time when the variant is reloaded.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        Plugin controller configuration. null sets a default configuration.
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem creating the plugin controller configuration.

      • build

        void build(com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PolysunSettings polysunSettings,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
    throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        Method to pass Polysun properties to this plugin controller. E.g. plugin controller GUI settings. This method is called when Polysun plugin controller in Polysun is built, e.g. a plugin controller property has been changed by the user. The state of the current configuration could be kept for later use during the simulation.
        Parameters:
        polysunSettings - The properties and settings of Polysun
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem creating the plugin controller configuration.

      • getPropertiesToHide

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPropertiesToHide(com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PolysunSettings polysunSettings,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Determines the GUI properties which must be hidden in the current configuration. E.g. if the flowrate is not fixed, the Fixflowrate property must be hidden.
        Parameters:
        polysunSettings - The configuration Polysun, user settings of properties
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        The list property names that must be hidden in the given configuration.

      • getSensorsToHide

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSensorsToHide(com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PolysunSettings polysunSettings,
                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Determines the sensors which must be hidden in the current configuration. E.g. if the flowrate is fixed, the flowrate sensor must be hidden.
        Parameters:
        polysunSettings - The configuration Polysun, user settings of properties
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        The list sensor names that must be hidden in the given configuration.

                                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)

        Parameters:
        polysunSettings - The configuration Polysun, user settings of properties
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        The list control signal names that must be hidden in the given configuration.

      • getFixedTimestep

        int getFixedTimestep(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Fixed timestep. For each timepoint which is a multiple of this fixedTimestep, the simulation does a timestep. The Polysun solver can do more timesteps if necessary. Example, for fixedTimestep of 180s, the simulation solver does a simulation at least at 0s, 180s, 360s, 480s, 720s, ...
        Parameters:
        parameters - General parameters
        Returns:
        The fixed timestep, or a value less than 1 for the default timestep (240s during day and 720s during the night)

      • initialiseSimulation

        void initialiseSimulation(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
                   throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        This method is called once before the simulation starts.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem

      • control

        int[] control(int simulationTime,
              boolean status,
              float[] sensors,
              float[] controlSignals,
              float[] logValues,
              boolean preRun,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
       throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        Does the control work. This method is called each timestep by Polysun if signals must be controlled according to the sensor values.
        Parameters:
        simulationTime - The simulation time in [s] beginning from the 1. January 00:00 (no leap year).
        status - The status of this controller according to user settings, true means enabled, false disabled. The status originates from the timer setting of the controller dialog. The user can enable or disable the controller for certain hours, days or month. This value should be respected by the controller implementation, otherwise it could lead to an unexpected user experience.
        sensors - The values of the sensors configured by the user (Input parameter).
        controlSignals - The control signals set by this plugin controller (Output parameter).
        logValues - The values to log in Polysun, e.g intermediate results. This value can be ignored. These values are shown in the Simulation Analysis or in the Log and Parameterizing output.
        preRun - Is this the real simulation or a pre run phase? This value can be ignored.
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        Timepoints [s]. Registers these timepoints in the future, where the simulation have to do a timestep. It doesn't matter, if the same timepoint will be registered several times. Timepoint in the array is in seconds from the 1. Jan. 00:00, or null if no additional timesteps are required. These timesteps can be used for time based controlling strategies.
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem. The simulation will be aborted.

      • terminateSimulation

        void terminateSimulation(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        This method is called once after the simulation.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Generic parameters

      • closeResources

        void closeResources()
        Closes resources and cleans up. This method is called if resources should be freed. Examples: Close files, disconnect connections
